column4: i've got a strange one, every now and then since I installed Karmic, my left mouse button stops working for a bit, then sometimes the screen saver will come on though I'm moving the mouse around and using the keyboard
my friend reported it to me first, then just now it happend to me for the first time
once I typed in my password at the screensaver the left mouse button worked again
antuo9us: no system load, it is doing it again now
very odd
i tried killing metacity and sparking up sawfish, but that did not fix it
i wonder if the screensaver is grabbing the mouse focus and running in the background
i just killed xscreensaver and that didn't fix it either
the scroll wheel and right mouse button do not work as expected either
usb

ubuntu or kubuntu? if ubuntu, right click the top panel, choose "add to panel" and drag the "system monitor" to the panel. Go to Monitor's options, activate all other things (memory, disk, etc) and watch CPU, LOAD and stuff. perhaps this gives you a clue, whats going in
sounds very uncommon... what are the hardware specs? try the system monitor and see, if something spikes
perhaps a reboot might do something. did you already try to restart X?
I'm a 10+ year linux user, I'm not rebooting :-)
sometimes restarting X does really help. especiall with gnome... *g*
CTRL+ALT+BACKSPACE FTW
